WebdriverIO allows you to test in actual.message: WebdriverIO به شما این امکان می دهد که تست را در مرورگر واقعی و یا در دستگاه تلفن همراه واقعی که کاربران از آن استفاده می‌کنند انجام دهید.

Use WebdriverIO for full e2e or unit and.message: از WebdriverIO برای تست کامل e2e یا یونیت تست و یا تست کامپوننت در مرورگر استفاده کنید.

WebdriverIO automatically waits for elem.message: WebdriverIO به طور خودکار منتظر می ماند تا عناصر قبل از تعامل با آنها ظاهر شوند.

Easy setup for web component testing wit.message: راه اندازی آسان برای تست اجزای وب با:

homepage.hightlight.createProject.message: در چند ثانیه با WebdriverIO شروع کنید

The WebdriverIO testrunner comes with a.message: The WebdriverIO testrunner comes with a command line interface that provides a powerful configuration utility and helps you to create your test setup in less than a minute. It let's you pick from available test framework integrations and easily allows to add all supported reporter and service plugins!

With just one simple command you can set.message: With just one simple command you can set up a complete test suite:

Integration to developer tools such as:.message: Integration to developer tools such as:

versions.description.message: Docusaurus 2 Versions page listing all documented site versions

The project team releases new major vers.message: The project team releases new major versions roughly on a yearly cadence. LTS release status is "long-term support", which typically guarantees that critical bugs will be fixed for a total of 12 months until a new major release is made.

Here you can find the documentation for.message: Here you can find the documentation for current released version.

Here you can find documentation for prev.message: Here you can find documentation for previous versions of Docusaurus.

homepage.highlight.getStartedOnYouTube.message: Start learning more about WebdriverIO and how to get started {youtubeLink}.

homepage.highlight.getStartedOnYouTube.l.description: The label for the link to my YouTube

homepage.highlight.conferenceTalk.message: The community around WebdriverIO is actively speaking on various user groups or conferences about specific topics around automated testing with WebdriverIO. Check out this talk on {youtubeLink} by {videoAuthor} at {conferenceLink}.

homepage.highlight.youtubeChannels.message: There is also many YouTube Channels with useful tutorials by community members such as {channelOne}, {channelTwo} or {channelThree}.

homepage.highlight.devtools.message: WebdriverIO not only runs automation based on the WebDriver protocol, it also leverages native browser APIs to enable integrations to popular developer tools such as {devtoolsLink} or {lighthouseLink}. With the {devtoolsServiceLink} plugin you have access to commands for validating if you app is a valid PWA application as well as to commands for capturing frontend performance metrics such as `speedIndex` and others.

homepage.features.crossBrowser.message: Cross browser support via automation through {webdriverLink} and {bidiLink}.

homepage.features.mobile.message: Run WebdriverIO on real mobile devices, smart TVs or other IoT devices through {appiumLink}.

homepage.features.support.message: Running a {supportChannelLink} with over 8k members and a rich ecosystem of community maintained plugins.

homepage.tagline.message: Next-gen browser and mobile automation test framework for Node.js

homepage.componentTesting.para1.message: WebdriverIO is an {allInOne} framework for your web app development. It enables you to run small and lightweight component tests as well as running e2e test scenarios in the browser or on a mobile device. This guarantees that you to do the testing in an environment {usedBy}.

homepage.componentTesting.heading.message: E2E and Unit / Component Testing in real Browser!

homepage.componentTesting.para2.message: It comes with smart selector strategies that simplify interacting e.g. with {reactComponents} or running deep selector queries with nested shadow DOM trees. As interactions happen through a standardized automation protocol it is guaranteed they behave natively and aren't just JavaScript emulated.
